NMS ORIENTATION WEEK!
This year, "back-to-school" begins with Orientation Week! Students in grades 6 through 8 have been scheduled by grade level and alphabetically by last name to organize multiple, small group sessions each day from September 14-18. (see schedule)

Social distancing and the use of masks will be important during all of our orientation sessions.

Please contact our main office if you have any questions at 607-334-1600. We can't wait to see our students!

NHS SENIOR PARADE!

Join us as we celebrate the Class of 2020 with the community in a special Senior Parade. On Friday, June 26, the Norwich Police Department, in cooperation with the Norwich Fire Department, will escort the seniors as they drive through town. The parade will take place on Route 12 from the Hale Street traffic light north toward Aldi's. Parade start time will be approximately 9pm, rain or shine!

Seniors are invited to decorate cars and cruise (safely) down Route 12. Simply follow the lead car and parade route as designated.

Family members are asked to line the streets and sidewalks with posters, pom-poms and noisemakers! (Parents are only permitted in the parade if driving a vehicle for an NHS Senior. In case of rain, parent drivers should come to the high school gym parking lot at 9pm.)

Everyone attending the parade should wear a mask and practice safe social distancing.

Let's send our 2020 graduates off in style!

This year's annual NMS Spelling Bee continued for 18 rounds as eight brave students competed in the NMS LIbrary. As the competition progressed, the difficulty level became more advanced and included words like "appetite", "constellation" and "assistance". NMS S-P-E-L-L-I-N-G BEE
This year's annual NMS Spelling Bee continued for 18 rounds as eight brave students competed in the NMS LIbrary. As the competition progressed, the difficulty level became more advanced and included words like "appetite", "constellation" and "assistance". In the last round, returning two-time champion Leona Tyler faced sixth grader Liam Hunter. After an error in the word "prudence", Leona went to the microphone one more time to spell a final word to earn the championship. She successfully spelled the word "coincidence" and won the title of 2020 Spelling Bee Champion.

As a three-time champion during grades 6 through 8, NMS will follow Leona as she competes at the regional competition at SUNY Oneonta. Winners of that event move on the national Scripps Spelling Bee in Washington D.C. Congratulations to all eight of our students for taking on this c-h-a-l-l-e-n-g-e!

shared_text:
Norwich Middle School
August 28, 2019 at 2:15 PM ·

MIDDLE SCHOOL FLOODED WITH INCOMING 6TH GRADERS!

There was standing room only at this year’s 6th grade orientation! NMS welcomed one of its’ largest classes on record with 155 incoming 6th graders. With approximately a 90% attendance rate for orientation, those students and their family members packed the cafetorium and the halls.

Principal Scott Ryan kicked off the evening presenting information about schedules, use of technology, expectations, homework policy and extra-curricular opportunities. Following the presentation, students had time to navigate the halls to find classrooms and practice opening the lockers. (The biggest smiles always appear when students successfully open those locker doors!)

Upcoming events on the calendar include the following:
* New Student Orientation: Wednesday, August 28, 12:00-1:00pm
* Meet & Greet Day: Wednesday, September 4, 1:00-3:00pm - for ALL students
* First Day of School: Thursday, September 5, 7:30am

All athletes are required to complete a sports interview prior to the start of the fall sports season. Contact Jamie Wright to schedule an appointment with our high school health office at (607) 334-1600 extension 1436. Appointments can be made for Monday, August 12, through Wednesday, August 14.
